result.name: british-geological-survey-bgs-geochemical-and-sampling-survey-s1-72-02-bristol-channel-gam-1972
result.notes: This marine geochemical and sampling survey undertaken by Istititute of Geological Sciences (BGS) in conjuction with AERE, Harwell took place September to October 1972 in the Bristol Channel on m.v. Observer. This involved calibration of a sea-bed gamma spectometer towed over an area of relatively well known geology north-east of Lundy with subsequent work in the lesser known area of Bridgwater Bay. In the latter area, gravity cores were taken to calibrate the spectometer.

resources.description: GeoIndex allows users to search for information about BGS data collections covering the UK and other areas world wide. Access is free, the interface is easy to use, and it has been developed to enable users to check coverage of different types of data and find out some background information about the data. More detailed information can be obtained by further enquiry through the website.
